🔍 SPHERE VRF FAQ

Everything you need to know about how SPHERE VRF delivers trusted randomness.

SPHERE VRF is a decentralized, verifiable randomness service that ensures every random number generated is accompanied by cryptographic proof. It allows clients to request randomness and verify results in real time, making it ideal for games, audits, lotteries, and more.

Each random number generated by SPHERE VRF includes a cryptographic proof that can be independently verified. This proof confirms the number was generated without tampering or manipulation.

Yep. Requests are processed by multiple independent nodes across the SPHERE network. This means no single party controls the outcome, and every step is cryptographically recorded.

SPHERE VRF is perfect for any use case requiring trustless randomness — like online games, NFT minting, lottery draws, decentralized voting, and fairness auditing in smart contracts.

SPHERE VRF can handle hundreds of requests per second depending on hardware, with real-time verification handled by a distributed network of nodes to ensure minimal latency and maximum integrity.

Absolutely. The verification process is fully transparent. Clients can independently confirm the validity of any result using the proof data returned with each request.

SPHERE is the decentralized foundation powering SPHERE VRF. It handles contact management, encrypted communication, and computational workloads — all without relying on centralized servers.

SPHERE VRF is randomness you can trust — built for integrity, transparency, and zero bullshit.
